summary: This is a supplemental declaration by Nicole McFarland, a BOP staff attorney, filed in a FOIA lawsuit by The New York Times against the Federal Bureau of Prisons. The declaration corrects a prior statement regarding a log entry for Jeffrey Epstein, clarifying it recorded a phone call he made on July 30, 2020, not a visit.

persons.name: Nicole McFarland
persons.role: Staff Attorney at the Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: Employee of the Federal Bureau of Prisons who submitted a declaration in a FOIA lawsuit to correct a prior statement about a log entry for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate for whom a log entry, initially misdescribed as showing a visit, actually recorded a phone call made on July 30, 2020.

connections.description: McFarland, as a BOP staff attorney, is involved in the legal and administrative record-keeping concerning inmate Epstein as part of a FOIA lawsuit.

events.title: Epstein's Phone Call Logged
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made a phone call that was recorded in the Intake Screening Phone Log at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Original Declaration Filed
events.description: Nicole McFarland submitted her original declaration in the FOIA case, which contained an error about the nature of the July 30 log entry.

events.title: Supplemental Declaration Filed
events.description: Nicole McFarland filed this supplemental declaration to correct the error in her original declaration regarding the July 30 log.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A prior declaration incorrectly stated a log book showed a visitor for Jeffrey Epstein on July 30, 2020.
The corrected information is that the log book (an Intake Screening Phone Log) actually showed a phone call made by Epstein on July 30, 2020.
This correction is part of a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times against the Federal Bureau of Prisons seeking records.
The document highlights ongoing legal and public scrutiny over record-keeping related to Jeffrey Epstein while in BOP custody.
